title: Mteto Nyati to run MTN's SA business
text:
13 July 2015 17:36 CET Mteto Nyati to run MTN's SA business By bdlive.co.za 
The MTN Group has appointed Mteto Nyati as MTN SA CEO, effective from Monday. 
This follows the surprise departure of Ahmad Farroukh, who resigned last week. Mr Nyati joined MTN in October last year as the group’s chief enterprise officer. 
The enterprise business provides integrated information and communications technology services to corporate clients. 
MTN Group president and CEO Sifiso Dabengwa said: “We believe the appointment of a leader of Nyati’s calibre and competencies will greatly enhance our efforts to strengthen the confidence of our customers and reinvigorate our people.” 
Mr Nyati will be faced with the task of ending an impasse between the company and the Communication Workers Union, whose members have been on strike for nearly two months, which has affected some of the company’s services.
